Defendant in the case who had his vehicle stopped by a United States Border Patrol agent and is a United States citizen, challenges the stop of his white sedan
Defendant in the case who was stopped by an officer of the Freer Police Department, driver of the black truck, exhibited nervous behavior during the stop, claimed the vehicle belonged to his aunt and then his cousin, transported to a checkpoint for further questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRI: Defendants indicted for transporting undocumented aliens within the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent stationed at the Freer immigration checkpoint who decided to investigate vehicles, followed suspicious vehicles, and testified about common types of traffic on FM 2050; has experience with smugglers using rental cars; observed passengers in a white sedan and noted their behavior; witness during cross examination
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rodriguez: United States Border Patrol Agent who alerted to two suspicious vehicles and is involved in the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Rodriguez: United States Border Patrol Agent who alerted to the two vehicles, likely referring to Rodriguez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent who decided to go look into the vehicles, followed them, and testified about his experience with traffic on FM 2050; made observations about the passengers and drivers of the vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino and Rodriguez: Border Patrol agents involved in the investigation of suspicious vehicles on FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mills Bennett: Involved in the case, mentioned during the cross examination of Agent Trevino
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reymundo Reyes: Officer of the Freer Police Department who conducted a traffic stop on Ignacio Rodriguez's black truck, observed Ignacio Rodriguez's nervous behavior during the stop, and decided to impound the vehicle due to lack of insurance information and uncertainty about the vehicle's ownership, informed by Agent Benavides
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and Jorge Luis Tr: Individuals involved in the case, with Ignacio Rodriguez as a defendant and Jorge Luis Trevino as a United States Border Patrol Agent
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hugo Benavides: United States Border Patrol Agent who received a phone call regarding the traffic stop of Ignacio Rodriguez, arrived at the scene to assist Officer Reyes, transported Ignacio Rodriguez to a checkpoint for further questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mr. Rodriguez: Defendant stopped by Officer Reyes, driver of the vehicle, transported to a checkpoint for further questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Benavides: United States Border Patrol Agent who conducted questioning and transported Ignacio Rodriguez to a checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security involved in investigating an attempted alien smuggling event, testified about the interview with Ignacio Rodriguez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor and his partner: Agents who interviewed Ignacio Rodriguez after he waived his Miranda rights
